programme.title: Science For Evil Geniuses

programme.title: Ancient Murders Unearthed
programme.desc: Homicide detective Rod Demery and scientist Professor Turi King study an 800-year-old partial skeleton found in Berwick, Scotland; Rod investigates a possible motive of robbery, and Turi's injury analysis reveals the victim may have been an archer.

programme.title: Ancient Murders Unearthed
programme.desc: Homicide detective Rod Demery and scientist Professor Turi King visit the ancient Italian city of Verona to investigate the death of 14th-century warlord Cangrande della Scala, who died suddenly at the height of his power.

programme.title: Terror!
programme.desc: On July 22, 2011, Anders Breivik detonates a van bomb in Oslo's government quarter, killing eight and triggering chaos, then drives to a Norwegian island and opens fire at a Workers' Youth League summer camp, killing 69 participants.

programme.title: Terror!
programme.desc: The USS Cole is docked for refueling in Aden, Yemen, when two men in a small boat ram the warship at full speed and the resulting explosion kills 17 sailors Oct. 12, 2000.

programme.title: War Gamers
programme.desc: When WW2 breaks out between Britain and Germany, the Royal Navy must find a way to sink the German U-boats before they cut off their vital transatlantic shipping routes.

programme.title: War Gamers
programme.desc: Dönitz's U-boats continue to terrorize the transatlantic routes; in Britain, the WRENS prepare to frustrate his plans, while the Royal Navy turns to a retired wargamer.

programme.title: War Gamers
programme.desc: Gilbert Roberts sets up a tactical school to counter the U-boats; he enlists the help of Jean Laidlaw and a small team of Wrens to wargame battles and develop new maneuvers.

programme.title: War Gamers
programme.desc: Roberts and Laidlaw uncovered a flaw in the Royal Navy's anti-U-boat tactic "Buttercup"; they must convince Noble that their new maneuver will sink Dönitz's U-boats.

programme.title: War Gamers
programme.desc: In 1943, pressure mounts on WATU to prove their value; when convoy ONS.5 catches Dönitz's attention, the stage is set for the battle that will turn the tide of the Atlantic war.

programme.title: War Gamers
programme.desc: After ONS.5, Roberts and Laidlaw must do everything in their power to counteract Dönitz's acoustic torpedo and recapture the waves before the impending D-Day landings.

programme.title: Oops I Changed the World
programme.desc: A failed blood pressure medicine and an unexpectedly hairy woman lead to a cure for baldness; how messing around with a scientific toy gave us the x-ray.

programme.title: Oops I Changed the World
programme.desc: A Swiss chemist's attempt to make a lung drug results in LSD; the son of enslaved parents tries to reverse the fortunes of sharecroppers and inadvertently gives rise to PB&J.

programme.title: Butterfly Effect
programme.desc: Distant ancestors were afraid of lightning and thought that it was sent by the gods; today, electricity is part of people's daily lives.

programme.title: Butterfly Effect
programme.desc: Early in their history, humans realize that they can affect nature by controlling fire, making tools and taming wild animals; what they were not given by nature, they harnessed in other species.

programme.title: It Takes a Killer
programme.desc: When a Southern California high school teacher suddenly dies, it appears his death was due to natural causes, but once law enforcement starts looking into his widow, they uncover her treacherous past and her preference for using poison to kill.

programme.title: It Takes a Killer
programme.desc: A heartbroken millionaire marries a much younger woman, ending with a shotgun blast to the stomach and a lethal dose of poison.

programme.title: It Takes a Killer
programme.desc: When a chef's wife goes missing from Southern California, it initially appears she may have left voluntarily, yet, after months of investigation, detectives uncover she was the victim of a ruthless homicide and an even more savage cover up.

programme.title: It Takes a Killer
programme.desc: A vicious custody battle ends when one of the parents vanishes without a trace; law enforcement investigates the usual suspects only to uncover a seemingly premeditated murder and a sickening attempt to cover it up.

programme.title: It Takes a Killer
programme.desc: When police stop investigating the disappearance of a family of atheists, an intrepid journalist picks up the torch and hunts down a mastermind hell-bent on revenge who resulted to kidnapping, extortion and murder.

programme.title: The Longest Yard

programme.title: The Return of the Living Dead

programme.title: Children of a Lesser God

programme.title: Poltergeist III

programme.title: Outlaws and Angels
programme.desc: In 1887, three violent fugitives hold a couple and their children (Francesca Eastwood, Madisen Beaty) hostage in their isolated New Mexico farmhouse.

programme.title: No Country for Old Men
programme.desc: An aging lawman (Tommy Lee Jones) reflects on his past and laments a changing world while trying to find and protect a hunter who took the cash from a drug deal gone bad.

programme.title: Rocky

programme.title: Creed
programme.desc: Long-retired boxer Rocky Balboa (Sylvester Stallone) agrees to train Apollo Creed's son (Michael B. Jordan) to become a fighter, even as the former champ battles an opponent deadlier than any he ever faced in the ring.

programme.title: Creed II
programme.desc: Under guidance from Rocky Balboa, boxing phenom Adonis Johnson prepares for a showdown against the son of Ivan Drago, the former Russian fighter who killed Apollo Creed in the ring.

programme.title: The Magnificent Seven
programme.desc: Desperate townspeople hire seven mercenaries (Denzel Washington, Chris Pratt, Ethan Hawke) to battle a greedy industrialist (Peter Sarsgaard) and his ruthless henchmen in the Old West.

programme.title: Godfather of Harlem

programme.title: Married to the Mob
programme.desc: An FBI agent (Matthew Modine) gets close to a gangster's widow (Michelle Pfeiffer) in order to nab a crime boss (Dean Stockwell).

programme.title: Stargate

programme.title: Our Kind of Traitor

programme.desc: A cocky American (Robert Redford) skis and apres-skis Europe, training with his coach (Gene Hackman) for the Olympics.

programme.title: The Night of the Hunter
programme.desc: The Rev. Harry Powell, a religious fanatic and serial killer, meets condemned murderer Ben Harper in prison, who tells him about hiding $10,000 in stolen loot. After he's released, Powell tracks down Harper's widow, Willa, and her two children.

programme.title: Diablo
programme.desc: A young Civil War veteran (Scott Eastwood) embarks on a quest to save his kidnapped wife (Camilla Belle) from a band of ruthless Mexican bandits.

programme.title: Hondo
programme.desc: An Indian scout attempts to escort a homesteader's wife and her son back to safety after her husband deserts her during an Apache attack. When she refuses to go, he stays on to help and, over time, forms a strong bond with both her and her son.

programme.title: Disturbing Behavior
programme.desc: High-school students (James Marsden, Katie Holmes, Nick Stahl) suspect that sinister forces are controlling their too-perfect classmates.

programme.title: Better Man
programme.desc: The true story of the meteoric rise, dramatic fall, and remarkable resurgence of British pop superstar Robbie Williams.

programme.desc: With a game, an Italian Jew (Roberto Benigni) shields his son (Giorgio Cantarini) from Nazi horrors in a concentration camp during World War II.

programme.desc: A rich reporter tours outback Australia with a crocodile hunter, then brings him to Manhattan.

Whether it's inviting the most provocative guests to the signature pink couch or hearing your take on controversial topics, the conversations never disappoint.
